title: Brendan Rodgers instructed Celtic physio 'not to lose sight' of Moussa Dembele during deadline day trip to London
text:
Sport Brendan Rodgers instructed Celtic physio 'not to lose sight' of Moussa Dembele during deadline day trip to London Dembele flew to London on transfer deadline day amid speculation Chelsea would make a move for the French star Share Dembele has been thriving under Rodgers (Photo: 2016 Getty Images) Share Get Chelsea   Thank you for subscribing!   
Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers has revealed that club officials kept an extremely tight leash on Moussa Dembele during his deadline day trip to a London hospital - instructing the physio not to let the Bhoys striker “out of sight”. 
Free-scoring Dembele has bagged 20 goals in 38 games since joining Celtic last summer from Championship side Fulham. 
And that has seen the France Under-21 international’s reputation rise, with a host of scouts flocking to Celtic Park to check up on the hitman. 
Tottenham had watched Dembele ahead of his move north of the border, but speculation lately has been that Chelsea were keen on making a deadline day move. Goals have been coming freely for Dembele in Scotland (Photo: Getty) 
However, despite being pictured on a flight to London, Dembele was only in town for a hospital visit - but Rodgers was taking no chances. 
"We had to make sure the physio didn't lose sight of him down there," Rodgers told. 
"Ironically the hospital he was in was in Chelsea, believe it or not. So I said to Tim, be like Franco Baresi and just stay tight to him. 
"But he was happy to come back. He is loving it here. He got some fluid out of his knee, he has had a good reaction to it, so we will see how he is for the weekend," Rodgers added. Brendan Rodgers is delighted to be keeping hold of his star striker (Photo: Getty) Read More Chelsea already plotting £100m summer transfer spree 
Chelsea chief Antonio Conte is set to move in the market for a new forward in the summer.
